description: Colorado statewide code baseline for HVAC/Mechanical work - Reviewable code content and requirements

adopted_codes.name: International Mechanical Code
adopted_codes.notes: Colorado adopted 2021 IMC with state amendments per CRS 24-32-3303

adopted_codes.name: International Fuel Gas Code
adopted_codes.notes: Colorado adopted 2021 IFGC with state amendments per CRS 24-32-3303

adopted_codes.name: International Energy Conservation Code
adopted_codes.notes: Energy efficiency requirements for HVAC installations per CRS 24-32-3303

adopted_codes.name: National Electrical Code
adopted_codes.notes: Applicable for HVAC electrical connections and controls per CRS 12-115-101

subsections.title: General
subsections.base_text: Every space containing fuel-burning appliances shall be provided with combustion air in accordance with Sections 304.2 through 304.12.
subsections.colorado_amendment: For installations above 5,000 feet elevation, combustion air openings shall be sized at 110% of calculated requirements to account for reduced air density.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Inspectors will verify opening sizes match BTU input calculations adjusted for altitude

subsections.title: Opening Size and Location
subsections.base_text: Outdoor combustion air openings shall have a free area of not less than 1 square inch per 4,000 Btu/h (550 mmÂ²/kW) of total input rating of all equipment located in the space.
subsections.colorado_amendment: At elevations above 5,000 feet, use 1 square inch per 3,600 Btu/h minimum. For elevations above 8,000 feet, use 1 square inch per 3,200 Btu/h.
subsections.applicability: All appliances using outdoor combustion air
subsections.enforcement_notes: Common violation: not accounting for altitude when sizing openings

subsections.title: Combustion Air Ducts
subsections.base_text: Combustion air ducts shall be constructed of galvanized steel complying with Chapter 6 or of a material having equivalent corrosion resistance, strength and rigidity.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Must be rigid duct, flex duct not permitted

subsections.title: Appliances in Rooms
subsections.base_text: Rooms containing appliances requiring access shall be provided with a door and an unobstructed passageway measuring not less than 36 inches (914 mm) wide and 80 inches (2032 mm) high.

subsections.title: Appliances in Attics
subsections.base_text: Attics containing appliances requiring access shall be provided with a passageway having unobstructed height of not less than 30 inches (762 mm) measured from the top of the ceiling framing members to the underside of the roof framing members.
subsections.colorado_amendment: Working space in front of equipment shall be minimum 30 inches. Some jurisdictions require 36 inches - verify local requirements.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Level service platform required if equipment exceeds 6 feet above platform

subsections.title: Electrical Requirements
subsections.base_text: A lighting fixture controlled by a switch located at the required passageway opening and a receptacle outlet shall be provided at or near the appliance location.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Receptacle must be within 25 feet of equipment

subsections.title: General
subsections.base_text: All fuel-burning appliances shall be vented to the outdoors in accordance with their listing and label and the manufacturer's installation instructions.
subsections.colorado_amendment: At high altitudes, verify manufacturer's altitude limitations and venting specifications. Some equipment requires special high-altitude venting kits.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Manufacturer's installation manual takes precedence over general code

subsections.title: Vent Connection
subsections.base_text: Vent connectors shall be constructed and installed in accordance with Sections 503.10, 503.11 and 503.12.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Single-wall connectors must maintain clearances to combustibles

subsections.title: General
subsections.base_text: Gas piping shall be installed in accordance with the sizing and installation requirements of this chapter.

subsections.title: Pipe Sizing
subsections.base_text: Gas piping shall be sized in accordance with Section 402.4.1 through 402.4.5 and Table 402.4.
subsections.colorado_amendment: At elevations above 2,000 feet, gas input ratings shall be reduced in accordance with equipment manufacturer specifications (note: this is a lower threshold than the 5,000 ft combustion air requirement as equipment derating begins earlier). This affects pipe sizing calculations.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Use longest length method for sizing, include all elbows and fittings

subsections.title: Joints, Seams and Connections
subsections.base_text: All longitudinal and transverse joints, seams and connections shall be securely fastened and sealed with welds, gaskets, mastics, mastic-plus-embedded-fabric systems or tapes.
subsections.enforcement_notes: Mastic or UL 181 listed tape required. Duct tape not acceptable

subsections.title: Support
subsections.base_text: Ducts shall be supported with approved hangers at intervals not exceeding 10 feet (3048 mm).
subsections.enforcement_notes: Flex duct must be fully extended, no compression or sagging

subsections.title: Drain Pipe Materials and Sizes
subsections.base_text: Components of the condensate disposal system shall be cast iron, galvanized steel, copper, cross-linked polyethylene, polybutylene, polyethylene, ABS, CPVC or PVC pipe and fittings.

subsections.title: Traps
subsections.base_text: Condensate drains shall be trapped as required by the equipment or appliance manufacturer.
subsections.applicability: Equipment with induced draft or negative pressure
subsections.enforcement_notes: Trap must be primed before final inspection

subsections.title: Auxiliary Drain Pan
subsections.base_text: Category IV condensing appliances shall be provided with a secondary drain or auxiliary drain pan if the primary drain line blocks.
subsections.applicability: Equipment installed in attics, above ceilings, or where leakage causes damage
subsections.enforcement_notes: Secondary drain must discharge to conspicuous location or have overflow switch

permit_requirements.when_required: A permit shall be required for the installation, relocation, replacement or alteration of mechanical systems, including HVAC equipment, ductwork, and fuel gas piping.

exemptions.description: Portable heating, cooling or ventilation appliances
Replacement of any part that does not alter approval of equipment or make such equipment unsafe
Self-contained refrigeration systems containing 10 pounds (4.54 kg) or less of refrigerant or actuated by motors of 1 horsepower (746 W) or less

inspection_requirements.rough_in: Required before any work is concealed. Includes gas piping, ductwork, venting, and equipment placement verification.
inspection_requirements.final: Required after installation is complete and operational. Includes startup, safety device testing, and code compliance verification.

altitude_adjustments.general: Colorado's high elevation affects HVAC equipment and code compliance in multiple ways

key_impacts.requirement: Gas and oil-fired equipment must be derated per manufacturer specifications. Typical deration is 4% per 1,000 feet above sea level.
Additional combustion air required due to reduced oxygen content. See IMC 304 amendments above.
Reduced air density affects draft. Some equipment requires special high-altitude venting configurations.
Natural gas and LP gas pressures may require adjustment. Verify regulator settings for altitude.
